data.text:
The lives & livelihoods of hundreds of millions Africans are at stake not just due to #COVID19, but mostly due to the economic impacts of the response.

--  @UNHumanRights chief @mbachelet on mitigating the impacts of the #coronavirus crisis in Africa. https://t.co/qM3XuvqdmA https://t.co/0JA9ZNJlv4

Let us draw from the many Ramadan lessons of mercy & compassion, of dignity and rights, of mutual respect & understanding, of unity & solidarity.

-- @antonioguterres on #EidAlFitr. 

#EidMubarak to all our followers who are celebrating! https://t.co/zgrf2vANDL

"Unless we act now to address the mental health needs associated with the pandemic, there will be enormous long-term consequences for families, communities & societies." 

-- @antonioguterres on mental health & #COVID19 in @TIME.

https://t.co/SrnUa7FBVd

Sharing trusted & verified information is vital during a crisis like #COVID19. Here are 5 ways to spot misinformation. 

Get more Verified advice: https://t.co/LV9n3DX6QM https://t.co/lTUGo5n4ZF

عيد مبارك

#EidMubarak! Wishing all those who are celebrating a happy, safe and peaceful #EidalFitr. https://t.co/Fibsv1KePQ

During these times of high-stress and uncertainty amid the #COVID19 pandemic, it's important to look after yourself - and others. 

Stay safe and stay positive. We are in this together -- and we will get through this together. https://t.co/3EHAHiVpp3

🎨: Saprila Anindita https://t.co/H8qsUmxie3

Meet Abdulkader - he produces fresh bread to 90,000 Syrians. 

Amid the #COVID19 pandemic, he's providing a vital source of food & showing solidarity with the people of Aleppo. https://t.co/Vb5dN79a7v via @WFP https://t.co/cg5bYPyQHz

"As we combat this pandemic, we have a duty to protect people, end stigma and prevent violence."

-- @antonioguterres calls for global efforts to end hate speech amid the #COVID19 crisis. https://t.co/swmZgUCH5h https://t.co/lKVF8GDaI3

Forests are key for water supplies, livelihoods, tackling the climate emergency & much more.

Yet our forests are under threat. 

Latest from @FAO & @UNEP: https://t.co/VSbFV69SWp #BiodiversityDay #SOFO2020 https://t.co/xIfTjLPuhv

Obstetric fistula is a devastating, yet completely preventable childbirth injury.

Learn more on Saturday's International Day to End Obstetric Fistula. https://t.co/TftAuuy8YJ via @UNFPA https://t.co/mjWpPGFNVb

People around the world are uniting in solidarity in the face of #COVID19.

See inspirational examples in this new @Twitter moment. https://t.co/0dWQWruOuk

Loss of biodiversity threatens all by increasing emergence of zoonotic diseases such as #COVID19. 

On Friday's #BiodiversityDay — and every day — let's protect & nurture our ecosystems. https://t.co/e5lxL5WPWm https://t.co/8uPMDgOVHU

UNITED we share
🎨Culture
📚Education
📲Information
📖Knowledge
🧪Sciences

Amid the #COVID19 crisis, our strength is in our unity. https://t.co/cNS0wwcvVQ via @UNESCO https://t.co/K7Qpps4Sm5

"#COVID19 — which emanated from the wild — has shown how human health is intimately connected with our relationship to the natural world."

-- @antonioguterres on Friday's #BiodiversityDay. https://t.co/nIhb5K3II2 https://t.co/OAkB9BShB2

Up to 500,000 families may have lost their homes across India and Bangladesh as a result of #CycloneAmphan. 

@UNOCHA & humanitarian partners are on the ground to assess the situation and provide support. https://t.co/rstlxd3HOn

Healthy ecosystems can help solve many of our challenges — from providing livelihoods, to improving food security & promoting human health.

More on Friday's #BiodiversityDay. https://t.co/C51jpP924w via @UNBiodiversity 

https://t.co/tW0t6oj8zd

For everything that #COVID19 has taken from us, it has also given something: a reminder of what really matters and the opportunity to build a common future. 

We are stronger TOGETHER! https://t.co/tsGUhNhrv2 via @WHO 

https://t.co/D8D6cQ4si9

As we work together to contain #COVID19, we must also work to contain misinformation. 

That's why we're launching Verified, a new initiative to deliver trusted information, life-saving advice and stories from the best of humanity. https://t.co/fIsE7lHkTF https://t.co/sWaRnbkH7i

From Olympic athletes to Hello Kitty -- the UN is working with supporters around the world to help inspire people to #BeActive despite mobility restrictions put in place due to #COVID19.

https://t.co/GXkIPjJ4AJ

An additional 10 million children may be at risk of acute malnutrition worldwide due to the #COVID19 pandemic.

@WFP is working with governments to monitor vulnerable populations & adapt nutrition support to protect those in need. https://t.co/FWpVhmFUCN https://t.co/PKr1TcPWOY

Amid the #COVID19 pandemic, culture is providing a sense of comfort & connection for people around the world.

On Thursday's World Day for #CulturalDiversity for Dialogue & Development, join @UNESCO in celebrating culture as a source of resilience. https://t.co/UtBLZeMQF0 https://t.co/KZvZxpXFvB

Tea has many health benefits due to its anti-inflammatory & antioxidant properties. 

On Thursday's first #InternationalTeaDay, find out more about one of the world's oldest beverages. https://t.co/EfW1b5J6zk https://t.co/d2K1iARvOL

Venezuela: In the face of #COVID19, agreement that strengthens country's democratic governance, with full respect for human rights & rule of law, is more urgent than ever, @UNDPPA chief @DicarloRosemary tells Security Council.

https://t.co/sVpTQP4sEv

Tea is grown in more than 35 countries & supports millions os smallholders & their families.

On Thursday's first #InternationalTeaDay, more from @FAO on how tea production contributes to employment, exports earnings & food security. https://t.co/6PiU3CKZHc https://t.co/k9hnhb0ygl

For the first time in 30 years, human development is expected to decline due to the impacts of #COVID19 

Closing gaps in health, education & access to technology critical for #coronavirus recovery efforts. https://t.co/BmrvSCLvyt via @UNDP 

https://t.co/nfH3gQcmbn

"Ending the pandemic in Africa is essential for ending it across the world."

-- @antonioguterres stresses the need for solidarity with African countries amid the #COVID19 crisis. https://t.co/RysDzikF9w https://t.co/KHwhm78Yot

Women in @UNPeacekeeping are on the frontlines of efforts to stop the spread of #COVID19.

They're raising awareness about #coronavirus & educating people about the importance of good hygiene practices. https://t.co/crCMN63HKl #ServingForPeace

 https://t.co/mLm9dwI538

Misinformation during a crisis like #COVID19 can result in people being left uninformed, unprotected & vulnerable.
❌ Don't share rumors
✔️ Choose content verified by reliable sources
https://t.co/vVgjjWDqog via @UNESCO 

 https://t.co/axW8VlKuID

During emergencies like #COVID19, the risk of outbreaks of diseases such as measles & polio increases.

#VaccinesWork to help keep us healthy & safe. More facts from @WHO: https://t.co/u7aXDQpyRP https://t.co/Zx9UpXADPU

Biodiversity supports all life on land & below water and is vital for: 
🍏 the food we eat,
🌬 the air we breathe,
💧 the water we drink.

Learn more during International Biodiversity Week. via @UNEP #ForNature

https://t.co/mjQIqBZRml

Syria: To meet the staggering humanitarian demands & prepare for the impact of #COVID19, @UNReliefChief calls on Security Council for renewal of cross-border aid operation to reach millions with life-saving assistance.
https://t.co/C3QjPnUUAU

Over 75% of the world’s food crops depend on pollinators such as bees. These guardians of biodiversity play a key role in achieving the #GlobalGoals. 

More from @FAO on Wednesday's #WorldBeeDay 🐝: https://t.co/FiNXZ0DWrx https://t.co/uBXA9jSbK6

Nurses
doctors
sanitation workers
journalists
truck drivers
grocery store workers
researchers
& all essential workers

are risking their well-being to serve their communities.

We thank them for being on the front lines during the #COVID19 pandemic.

🎨: Ruby Wang https://t.co/Nz5QA5tSBc

Extreme climate events, aggravated land use & pesticides are threatening the survival of bees.

On Wednesday's #WorldBeeDay 🐝, @UNDP explains how bees help the environment & enrich human life. https://t.co/8Gl0Yo2G3Z https://t.co/FN07w3OmyB

From delivering vital medical supplies to healthcare workers to providing handwashing stations in developing countries, see how the UN is helping the world tackle #COVID19 in this new @Twitter moment.

https://t.co/RIc2M5NvgX

People all over the world are showing solidarity amid the #COVID19 pandemic.

See how a Burundian refugee soapmaker in Kenya has scaled-up production of affordable soap to protect his community from #coronavirus. https://t.co/YCQwSwAIqs via @Refugees 

https://t.co/OUK8CuXC36

Family doctors are the backbone of primary health care, providing comprehensive & people-centred care — including during #COVID19.

On Tuesday's World Family Doctor Day, join us in thanking family physicians everywhere. https://t.co/AJ0EtcsRDK #ThanksHealthHeroes https://t.co/tzO1rxkqWJ

#COVID19: @UNEP steps up work on zoonotics and protecting environment to help nations reduce pandemic risks.

https://t.co/s7yCSwnuNU

From billboards to bread, humanitarian workers are using creativity to help some of the world's most vulnerable people stay healthy during the #COVID19 pandemic.
https://t.co/hn3oX3FZeY via @UNOCHA

#COVID19 is having a devastating impact on indigenous communities' way of life. 

@UNHumanRights experts are calling on governments to ensure that the rights of indigenous peoples are protected amid the #coronavirus crisis. https://t.co/hTBWsNgVHx https://t.co/kdeHoYkK5y

"Either we get through this pandemic together, or we fail. 
Either we stand together, or we fall apart. " 

-- @antonioguterres stresses the need for solidarity amid the #COVID19 crisis https://t.co/TapFs7zLbH #WHA73 https://t.co/lrfKbWOskW

Happiness & hope are shared by health workers in the Democratic Republic of Congo, as the last #Ebola patient is discharged from a treatment centre in Beni.

A 42-day observation period has begun to declare the end of the epidemic. via @WHOAFRO https://t.co/8NowQKc29H

Inaccessible health care, and lack of sanitation & clean water are posing new threats to the health & survival of indigenous peoples during the #coronavirus pandemic.

@UNDESA calls for inclusion of indigenous communities in #COVID19 response. https://t.co/Wk0cq34A8q https://t.co/XAZLTi9EVb

#COVID19 is changing our world -- but with the right approach, we can build back better & stronger. 

Recycling, reusing, planting trees - there are many ways to take #ClimateAction & play a part in making the world a better place. https://t.co/ObsefnV2ok https://t.co/rkjtGfBH9C

"Mental health services are an essential part of all government responses to #COVID19. They must be expanded and fully funded."

-- @antonioguterres on the need to urgently address the mental health dimension of the #coronavirus pandemic. https://t.co/sF86LWddaz https://t.co/6uisck4gIl

Hate speech, stigma, discrimination & xenophobia are all on rise as a result of #COVID19.

Here's how the UN is working to #StandUp4HumanRights & promote solidarity during the pandemic.

https://t.co/Gx6EK6NRJl

#ClimateAction: The US state of Hawaii has committed to generating 100% of its power through renewable energy by 2045. 

See how their efforts are contributing to reaching the #GlobalGoals. 

https://t.co/WtVJWoqw2A

Human rights are for everyone – no matter who you are or whom you love.
❤️🧡💛💚💙💜

Sunday is the International Day against Homophobia, Transphobia & Biphobia https://t.co/Ljui9G92Ag #StandUp4HumanRights #IDAHOBIT via UN @free_equal https://t.co/RC9YSBV8uy

In the Democratic Republic of Congo, women are key players in fighting the #coronavirus. 

With support from @UNPeacekeeping, a network of women in Democratic Republic of Congo are making face masks to support the #COVID19 response. 

https://t.co/aPmd2X1I4B

International cooperation on digital technology is essential to help defeat #COVID19 and achieve the #GlobalGoals.

-- @antonioguterres on Sunday's World Telecommunication & Information Society Day. https://t.co/861Dw26fPP https://t.co/DbUfa535G2

Human rights are for everyone – no matter who you are or whom you love.    

On Sunday’s International Day Against Homophobia, Transphobia & Biphobia, we celebrate the bravery & love of those who fight for #LGBTI equality. #StandUp4HumanRights #IDAHOBIT

https://t.co/uaW5MUjcwI

The #COVID19 pandemic has resulted in an alarming rise in discrimination around the world. 

In response, the UN has released new guidance for countering hate speech & stigma during the crisis: https://t.co/qv67QfWy81 #StandUp4HumanRights via @UN_GP_RtoP https://t.co/F6dVUa14r7

There is no health without mental health.

@antonioguterres spoke with Umair, an intensive care nurse in Pakistan, and Charlene, a South African advocate on mental health issues - and heard their recommendations for mitigating the mental health impact of #COVID19. https://t.co/gwsy7QYcez

As containment measures are gradually lifted in some places, the @worldbank has guidance for countries seeking to support workers impacted by #COVID19, as they shift to a new way of working.  

https://t.co/oY3Z568voT

We are in this together - and we will get through this, together.

The UN is working around the clock to help everyone, everywhere in the fight against #COVID19. https://t.co/3EHAHiVpp3 https://t.co/A4DOO2X7Iy

Lessons learned from the #Ebola outbreak in Sierra Leone are helping to strengthen the country’s response to #COVID19. via @UNMigration

https://t.co/qtWONlPGLl

Saturday is International Day of Light. 

Celebrate the role light plays in science, culture, art, education, & the #GlobalGoals - and the hope it can bring in challenging times. 
https://t.co/aIT9vDUCWX https://t.co/s68FyNT7FQ

Some of us might be physically apart, but love holds us together. 

Show solidarity and kindness on Saturday’s International Day of Living Together in Peace and every day. #COVID19

🎨:Daniel Stevens

https://t.co/kwmS9KZfff https://t.co/3M2gEpEMwa

Despite mobility & other logistical restrictions due to #COVID19, UN "solidarity flights" are rushing vital supplies to frontline health workers in some of the world's most vulnerable countries.

https://t.co/T7PMlLQANm

#COVID19 has caused immense suffering.

It has also brought to the fore the idea at the heart of Saturday's International Day of Living Together in Peace: we are a single human family.
- @antontioguterres. https://t.co/kwmS9KHEnH

🎨:Anita Bagdi https://t.co/EFrepL2tek

From making masks for healthcare workers to sharing food with neighbours, the #COVID19 pandemic has brought out the best in humanity.

Check out more inspiring examples of solidarity in our latest @Twitter moment. https://t.co/HmxKpYCljK

Women do 3 times as much unpaid care & domestic work as men.

Friday's #DayofFamilies is an opportunity to draw attention to gender stereotypes & find solutions to redistribute unpaid care & domestic work. https://t.co/i2eHGJ5xzg https://t.co/xnwKYkuU20

Unemployment & economic downturn due to #COVID19 can increase cases of #HumanTrafficking.

To #EndHumanTrafficking while fighting #coronavirus, @UNODC calls for investments in job creation and economic recovery. https://t.co/pIc9ueNEad 

https://t.co/3AYyrlKMzc

Being apart from loved ones during #COVID19 can be hard, but families are finding ways to stay connected. 

Friday's International #DayOfFamilies celebrates the care, support & love families can provide. https://t.co/qrx1eBmaXT https://t.co/0Ipgh2rja0

In the midst of #COVID19, cyberthreats to society, economy, & children, have multiplied enormously.

@ITU calls for safer & more secure access to digital service. https://t.co/yGRVrEoUVl

Lockdown, school closures & other major disruptions amid #COVID19 may affect mental health of both children & parents. 

On Friday's International #DayofFamilies, @UNICEF has tips on how families can support each other during the #coronavirus pandemic.

https://t.co/4FoBBOE9VT

Families are a lifeline for many during these difficult & uncertain times. 

On Friday's International #DayofFamilies, join us in celebrating families in all their diversity! https://t.co/qrx1eBDLPr https://t.co/cH30rThUvN

Physical distancing does not have to mean social or emotional isolation.

Connect with your loved ones. We are in this together -- and we will get through this together.
🎨: Karina Muranaga https://t.co/1jZ1A31My2

"Mental health services are an essential part of all government responses to #COVID19. They must be expanded and fully funded."

-- @antonioguterres on the need to urgently address the mental health dimension of the #coronavirus pandemic. https://t.co/sF86LWddaz https://t.co/RYdy7aIwaf

With museums around the world closed due to the #COVID19, many museums are opening their doors for virtual tours 📲.

Learn more about how culture can help people cope with the #coronavirus crisis during #MuseumWeek. https://t.co/Zi2RppFimf via @UNESCO 

 https://t.co/ktSK6RbMc8

Access to critical health technology can help countries better respond to #COVID19 & lessen the impacts on economies & populations. 

New UN initiative aims to scale-up local production of life-saving health resources for #coronavirus. https://t.co/ALA2HmgGYr via @UNTechBank https://t.co/sxfhAuZx20

Human rights must be protected throughout the #COVID19 pandemic. 

The UN Network on Migration is calling on countries to suspend the forced return of migrants during #coronavirus crisis. https://t.co/PD2YqNU0Ry via @UNMigration https://t.co/S5bnysEu4K

People are living longer, despite the #COVID19 crisis threatening recent achievements in worldwide health. 

New @WHO report also shows impact of the pandemic on achievement of the #GlobalGoals. https://t.co/y77NJQsY0x https://t.co/rD65ijGzq2

The UN is drawing on lessons learned from previous health crises - including its efforts to combat Ebola and the eradication of smallpox - as it supports the world's response to #COVID19. 
https://t.co/RFpLHOFKIZ

Impact of #COVID19 is projected to shrink global economy by 3.2% in 2020, pushing millions into poverty.

@UNDESA's #WorldEconomyReport outlines measures to stabilize & stimulate the economy and support the most vulnerable in society. https://t.co/PHLOxSxfEc https://t.co/5YwI3m6ZgD

The UN is working to save lives amid the #COVID19 pandemic, while continuing to support some of the world's most vulnerable people.

More on our work in this @Twitter moment. https://t.co/vl4Q1CArGP

Happy birthday to UN Messenger of Peace @StevieWonder, who has worked tirelessly to promote a more inclusive world for people with disabilities.

More on the importance of protecting the rights of all people during the #COVID19 pandemic. https://t.co/txF2ZZpF9v https://t.co/NEFtU7r2ow

#COVID19 has had a dramatic impact on mobility, with 100% of tourist destinations worldwide experiencing travel restrictions.

@UNWTO is working with partners to support the responsible & timely recovery of the tourism industry. https://t.co/N5HCcR99MN https://t.co/48p1WOIXqy

In South Sudan, @unmissmedia peacekeepers are assisting local authorities in curbing #COVID19 by disinfecting facilities & much more. 

More on how @UNPeacekeeping is supporting the fight against #coronavirus: https://t.co/UfynxxsAQq https://t.co/6VY9VZOtzs

The #coronavirus pandemic has no regard for religious or spiritual distinctions. We are all vulnerable — and that shared vulnerability reveals our common humanity.

-- @antonioguterres highlights role of religious leaders in the fight against #COVID19. https://t.co/oCYO7eLfCt https://t.co/VgGIHWJlot

Iraq: Despite multiple crises, including #COVID19 & plummeting oil revenues, a more prosperous & inclusive Iraq is still within reach, head of @UNIraq tells Security Council. 

https://t.co/d6auaiwJxn

People are spreading kindness & demonstrating solidarity through their words & deeds -- while inspiring others to do the same. 

No act of solidarity is too small in the fight against #COVID19. Here's how the UN is helping: https://t.co/2zxrPajoby
🎥: Kirk Hewitt https://t.co/D3VYevz1py

Nurses should work in safe environment and have access to healthcare service, especially when they are on the frontlines of the #COVID19 response.

Join us in thanking nurses everywhere on Tuesday's #InternationalNursesDay. https://t.co/kEvBV7yPvN https://t.co/8HYnRL1MIZ

Hate speech, stigma, discrimination & xenophobia are all on rise as a result of #COVID19. 

Here's how the UN is working to #StandUp4HumanRights & promote solidarity during the pandemic. 

https://t.co/Gx6EK75sAT

Amid #COVID19, nurses around the world are showing courage & dedication and suffering personal sacrifice to provide essential care services. 

Show solidarity on Tuesday's #InternationalNursesDay & every day. https://t.co/kEvBV7yPvN https://t.co/9GhNZtfEDt

For many women and girls, staying at home due to #COVID19 does not mean being safe. 

During May's #MentalHealthMonth, @UN_Women has details on how to spot the signs of abuse during the pandemic & resources to get help. https://t.co/8ZEu3iSlZw https://t.co/6Kox1Khmnt

Investing in nurses improves quality of care, promotes gender equality & supports economic growth. 
 
Show solidarity for nurses working tirelessly in the face of #COVID19 on Tuesday's #InternationalNursesDay & every day. https://t.co/kEvBV7QqUn https://t.co/cZNDXLJQVO

"Our commitment to achieving the #GlobalGoals has not changed, but the urgency to act has."

--@UNECOSOC President @mona_juul says coordinated global response to #COVID19 must also include focus on need to build a more inclusive & sustainable world. 

https://t.co/q5BIdVMTyM

Every day, nurses provide essential care services & save lives - and they are on the frontlines of the #COVID19 response.

Show solidarity and support on Tuesday's #InternationalNursesDay & every day. https://t.co/kEvBV7QqUn https://t.co/qgzujSbKQ7

500k more people in sub-Saharan Africa could die from AIDS-related illnesses in the next year due to service disruptions caused by #COVID19. 

@UNAIDS is urging governments to take urgent action to save lives. https://t.co/QFy2zwbxik https://t.co/ipgOepFgg5

When crises strike, inequalities worsen.

The #COVID19 pandemic is no exception -- and its impact on sexual & reproductive health and rights could be disastrous.

Latest from @UNFPA: https://t.co/YEX0uHkrq1 https://t.co/QbKotSUIEG

The worldwide response to #COVID19 has demonstrated the power of solidarity.

Amid the pandemic, new @UNDP partnerships are building on the global movement to share hope, kindness & unity.

https://t.co/2pXpcpLE5L
